When it comes to the timing belt, dealers and mechanics recommend replacement every 50,000 to 60,000 miles for most cars, while manufacturers advise replacement every 80,000 to 100,000 miles. Labor. When it comes to timing belt replacement (and any other form of auto repair), the labor drives the price of the repair. Replacing a timing belt can take as little as two hours and as much as six hours, depending on the skill of the mechanic, the make of the vehicle and any additional existing problems.
